result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven B Hause was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

Defendant Steven B Hause in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Steven B Hause in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CF550, 15CF82, 15CF101 AND 15CF327. 
15CF82, 15CF101 AND 15CF327: State requests to revoke bond in these 3 files. Court revokes bond in all 3 files. 15CF550: Preliminary hearing set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Steven B Hause in court with attorney Kari Suzanne Hoel.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF101, 15CF63, 15CF82 and 15CF327. 
15CF63: State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court grants. 
15CF82: Defendant pleads guilty to count 2. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. 
15CF101: Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty.
15CF327:Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 5. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty. State moves to dismiss and read-in counts 3 and 4. Court grants. 
Felony admonitions given. Victims rights have been complied with. 

PSI ordered. Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 09:30 am.
